ANONYMOUS.Defintion: made or done by someone whose name is not known or not made public

ASTIGMATISM.Defintion: a fault in the lens of the eye that reduces the quality of sight, especially a fault that stops the eye from focusing

CLERK.Defintion: a person who works in an office, dealing with records or performing general office duties

CLOSURE.Defintion: the feeling or act of bringing an unpleasant situation, time, or experience to an end, so that you are able to start new activities

CONCLUSIVE.Defintion: proving that something is true, or ending any doubt

CONVENT.Defintion: a building in which nuns (= members of a female religious order) live

COSMETICS.Defintion: substances put on the face or body that are intended to improve its appearance or quality

CREDIBLE.Defintion: able to be believed or trusted

CRYPT.Defintion: a room under the floor of a church where bodies are buried

EXORCIST.Defintion: to force an evil spirit to leave a person or place by using prayers or magic

EXTORTING.Defintion: to get something by force or threats, or with difficulty

FLUTE.Defintion: a tube-shaped musical instrument with a hole that you blow across at one end while holding the tube out horizontally to one side

HOSTAGE.Defintion: someone who is taken as a prisoner by an enemy in order to force the other people involved to do what the enemy wants

INTRIGUE.Defintion: to interest someone a lot, especially by being strange, unusual, or mysterious

INTRIGUING.Defintion: to interest someone a lot, especially by being strange, unusual, or mysterious

KIDNAPPED.Defintion: to take a person away illegally by force, usually in order to demand money in exchange for releasing them

LEADS.Defintion: pieces of information that may help you solve a crime

NUN.Defintion: a member of a female religious group that lives in a convent

ROAM.Defintion: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do

ROCKED.Defintion: caused feelings of shock or surprise

SCANDAL.Defintion: (an action or event that causes ) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval

SIGHTINGS.Defintion: an occasion when you see something or someone, especially something that is rare or trying to hide

SWAP.Defintion: to give something and be given something else instead

TAPE.Defintion: thin plastic in a long, narrow strip with a magnetic covering that allows sounds or sounds and pictures to be recorded and played again, especially one on which sound is recorded

TIP-OFF.Defintion: a secret warning or piece of secret information

TOMB.Defintion: a large stone structure or underground room where someone, especially an important person, is buried

WHEREABOUTS.Defintion: the place where a person or thing is

WRONGDOING.Defintion: a bad or an illegal action
